column4: can someone help me with a gnome-session error? maybe causing my system to lockup, have the syslog but not sure what it means
paste actual error and relevant log in pastebin, otherwise there's no way to possibly help
well the actual error is system lockup.. with a few gnome-session CRITICAL and WARNING's http://pastebin.com/pVxgeUiA
describe what happens (does it randomly lock up?  And then?  Do you have to hard reboot or can you get to a tty or use magic sysrq keys?)
yes randomly locks up, i used to have to cold reboot, but then i discovers the magic sysrq keys so i can safly reboot. Computer is a Lenovo thinkpad T510 btw
is there anything relevant in ~/.xsession-errors? or /var/log/Xorg.0.log perhaps?
i dont know about the Xorg log, its not timestampped so.. dunno where to look
heres the pastebin of the xsession-error log http://pastebin.com/A5XteJ9v
Technicly not, Running Linux Mint 10. but no one was answering in the Linux Mint channel and this issue happens on most distros.
please use the mint channel for support; we're not even sure what "this issue" is exactly...
ok, but the mint channel is the appropriate channel to ask for help with this
well put it this way, i was running ubuntu 11.04 an hour ago and its the same error
I can try to help you troubleshoot your ubuntu install if you wish
i wiped ubuntu for Mint, couldnt stand Unity :(
